title: MESSENGER interplanetary magnetic field (1-second/high resolution) in RTN coordinates - Prof. Sean C. Solomon (Carnegie Institution of Washington)

info.contact: Prof. Sean C. Solomon @ Carnegie Institution of Washington

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Number of milliseconds since the epoch

parameters.name: radialDistance_200
parameters.description: Radial distance of MESSENGER from the Sun (0.5 sec cadence). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['radialDistance', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: latitude_ecliptic_200
parameters.description: ----> North latitude from the ecliptic plane (0.5 sec cadence). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['latitude_ecliptic', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: azimuth_ecliptic_200
parameters.description: ----> Azimuthal angle from Earth-Sun line in ecliptic plane, positive in the direction of Earth's motion (0.5 sec cadence). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['azimuth_ecliptic', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_radial_200
parameters.description: (Good values at 0.5 sec cadence only) B radial (Br) in RTN coordinates . This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_radial_q', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_tangential_200
parameters.description: ----> (Good values at 0.5 sec cadence only) B tangential (Bt). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_tangential_q', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_normal_200
parameters.description: ----> (Good values at 0.5 sec cadence only) B normal (Bn). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_normal_q', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
